item.title: Lt. General Marc H. Sasseville tells a story
item.description: Lt. General Marc H. Sasseville was the acting operations group commander under the 113th Wing of the D.C. Air National Guard. He was one of four pilots given the mission of finding United Airlines Flight 93 during the September 11 attacks. He explains how he knew the U.S. was under attack the moment the 2nd plane hit the WTC’s south tower

item.title: those who gave their lives so we could be free.
item.description: Bud Haedike, was a T/SGT, U.S. Army Air Corps WWII veteran. Born on Memorial Day in 1925, Bud would have been 100 years old today. In our last interview with him, he shared an important message about those who gave their lives so we could be free.

item.title: WWII Veteran John “Lucky” Luckadoo passed away today at the age of 103.
item.description: WWII Veteran John “Lucky” Luckadoo passed away today at the age of 103. He served as a B-17 flying fortress pilot in the 100th bomb group of the 8th Air Force where he flew 25 missions over Europe. He was one of the last remaining WWII pilots from the “Bloody Hundredth,” the outfit portrayed in Masters of the Air. May he rest in peace.

item.title: Japanese Surrender Ceremony
item.description: The formal Japanese Surrender Ceremony, which officially ended World War II, took place on the decks of the battleship USS Missouri in Tokyo Bay on September 2, 1945. U.S. Marine Corps PFC Jerry Pedersen and his comrades were crammed on the deck of the Missouri, watching as the Japanese formally surrendered to General MacArthur. One of the last witnesses to an epic moment of history, Jerry Pedersen went on to devote himself to a life of peace. This interview was recorded in 2021 by The World War II Foundation.
